title: Do sweet potatoes grow underground? - Quora

response.answer_text: The sweet potato does not grow underground. It is a member of the Morning Glory family and therefore technically a creeper, who sends its flowering parts in long trails over the ground. What is eaten are the underground tubers of the plant, that are dug up like potatoes, hence the name sweet potato. When growing new sweet potatoes you treat them like potatoes by cutting up the tubers into pieces and dig them into the soil, waiting for new shoots to sprout. In certain countries young shoots are also eaten.

I LOVE sweet potatoes! Which are really not potatoes. They are root vegetables related to…..are you ready? Morning Glory flowers. They do indeed grow underground. I’ve planted many. Some people eat the shoots that protrude from the ground. They are very good for you and can be used in various recipes. One of my favorites is sweet potato pie. Hope this answers your question.
The sweet potatoes themselves grow under ground while their stems and leaves grow above ground.
